body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-7112 is created. 
I'd like to keep the URL logged as it has helped me a lot in many loggings over problems I encountered in live deploy. The amount of URL tempering by bots and/ or script kiddies is amazing and leads to all kind of warnings/ errors so I try to at least log it as often as possible since it often saves much time if an issue is required to be investigated at all.
I'll investigate the #2. of your suggestions and report back asap.
Usually the url is "globally logged" as a MDC item

When I do:
getParent().getClassRelativePath() -> parent relative path: org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettingsNotRenderableErrorStrategyTest$RenderBodyOnlyTestPage
(I can click in my IDE :) )
getClassRelativePath() -> class relative path: org.apache.wicket.markup.html.basic.Label:test 
(it only shows me the Class I already know but not where I put it into it as the "test" is the markup ID and if this is from repeater it wont help me much. All I know then is I set it on a Label in a Repeater anywhere on my page)

> getParent().getClassRelativePath() -> parent relative path: org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettingsNotRenderableErrorStrategyTest$RenderBodyOnlyTestPage

This is a private case (a chance) because you debug a component that is a direct child of the page. 
We need to make this useful for any component in the hierarchy.

Regarding the MDC: that was way too simple to be used... I'll remove the URL ðŸ‘ 

Regarding the "getClassRelativePath() -> class relative path: org.apache.wicket.markup.html.basic.Label:test"
This seems quite useless info to me, I still have no clue about the parent of the component where it has been placed at all. Every component has a parent IMHO, worst case its the page itself. So getParent().getClassRelativePath() shows me *where* the troublemaker is located at, while with "this.getClassRelativePath()" I only know it comes from a Label with id test in our test case?

PS: getPageRelativePath leads to a simple "test", that is because of the only item it is on the page but I dont think this will be helpful at all. I still prefer getParent().getClassRelativePath() since its better to have more detailed info than less...

getPage().getClass() + ":" + getClassRelativePath() ->
if I have Page A and then 3 levels of components before the failing one I only will get 
A.class:org.apache.wicket.markup.html.basic.Label:test

But not helpful if it fails on Parent LabelRepeaterDummy.class since I never know what the parent is that places and configures the component Label:rfb124 (rfb124 = auto ID from repeater);
So I know its on Page A and a Label:rfb124  but  cant soo where its really at.

I used getPageRelativePath() instead in latest commit.

```
SEVERE: /home/runner/work/wicket/wicket/wicket-extensions/target/classes/org/apache/wicket/extensions/ajax/markup/html/autocomplete/wicket-autocomplete.js:401:3: ERROR - [JSC_LANGUAGE_FEATURE] This language feature is only supported for ECMASCRIPT_2015 mode or better: let declaration.
  401| 			let input = Wicket.$(ajaxAttributes.c);
       			^
```
It seems the minifier needs some setting on to alloq arrow functions ...

We also need a Jira ticket for the changelog.
I created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-7120 and hopefully fixed the compiler errors in js
I just noticed that tests are now failing.
Looks like these dependencies are up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

> One thing that I'm missing but couldn't figure out was to write test with form hierarchy (parent/child form) with inputs and simulate filling text field and hitting "enter"...

Wicket-tester does not support testing JavaScript. 

For this we have QUnit based tests at src/main/js/...
@martin-g it this failing build ok? I can't reproduce failure locally with AsynchronousPageStoreTest
I am not sure why the `literal` is really needed though. The archetype works even without it.
@martin-g Hi, did you have time to look at this PR?

The code changes look OK to me but I don't have a real application to test them ...
I wonder whether some application in wicket-examples module could be extended/added to show the new behavior.

I could add second part to "form input" example which would contain two forms in hierarchy and just few input boxes + submit buttons but also enabled this setDefaultButton behaviour that would update some multiline label. Would that be enough?

> Would that be enough?

Yes! Thank you!

@martin-g I've implemented the example with form hierarchy, please have a look at it.
In case this PR is accepted is it possible to also release wicket 10.3.0?
OK, I won't notify you about version 4.x.x again, unless you re-open this PR.
OK, I won't notify you about version 5.x.x again, unless you re-open this PR.
@1azyman There was a problem with the CI builds. Could you please rebase the PR to latest `master` ? Thanks!
Looks like org.openrewrite.recipe:rewrite-recipe-bom is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

Looks like this PR has been edited by someone other than Dependabot. That means Dependabot can't rebase it - sorry!

If you're happy for Dependabot to recreate it from scratch, overwriting any edits, you can request `@dependabot recreate`.
I've started with table, didn't notice remains of it. Pushed change to span.

Soon, I guess!
Please follow the dev@ mailing list for the vote!
This still does not work. When will this work again?

> I am not sure why the `literal` is really needed though. The archetype works even without it.

Which version of mvn and java is needed for this to work without the literal changes?

> This still does not work. When will this work again?

Define "does not work"!

> > I am not sure why the `literal` is really needed though. The archetype works even without it.
> 
> 
> 
> Which version of mvn and java is needed for this to work without the literal changes?

This is a question for the Maven team. 
We were also surprised that the old syntax doesn't work. 
The Maven archetype plugin upgraded Velocity to some version where the old syntax is no more supported.
I guess we also need to create a separate branch for 10.x since this feature is the first targeted for version 11. No big deal, I can do it in the next days before merging this PR

I see no reason to keep this only for 11.x. 
@bitstorm What is the API break for 10.x ?
@martin-g my concern is if it is legit introducing a new module for API compatibility. Maybe we can use japicmp-maven-plugin to test if this change is acceptable.

The new module is only for tests. 
The tests from one module are extracted into their own module. I see no problems here.
The PackageResource handling in Wicket 9 and forward have diverged enough that the tests in this pull request won't work, even after reverting the changes in the core classes.

@bitstorm  In my humble opinion `branch-10.x` should be deleted and `master` should be used for 10.x releases until we really have an API break that requires the extra branches.
There are not many active developers at the moment and maintaining several branches just adds load.

```
   ../../wicket-extensions/src/main/java/org/apache/wicket/extensions/ajax/markup/html/autocomplete/wicket-autocomplete.js
[INFO]     472 |                var input = Wicket.$(ajaxAttributes.c);
[INFO]                              ^ 'input' is already defined.
[INFO]     626 |            element.firstChild.role = "listbox"
[INFO]                                                         ^ Missing semicolon.
[INFO]     677 |                    node.setAttribute("aria-posinset", i + 1)
[INFO]                                                                       ^ Missing semicolon.
[INFO]     678 |                    node.setAttribute("aria-setsize", elementCount)
[INFO]                                                                             ^ Missing semicolon.
```
The code style issues should be fixed now
This is not relevant for us, I misunderstood the requirements and will rephrase the jira issue.
The code style issues should be fixed now
sorry @martin-g , I've totally lost your last comment. Yes, I think you are right about branches. I will set back master branch as 10.x branch
